item.title: Exploring Fractals
item.description: Introduction I recently rewatched a video from Arthur C. Clarke which is where I first saw what fractals are. I saw this video while I was in high school and having rewatched it now I wondered if I can generate the Mandelbrot set and explore some parts of it myself. I did a quick search online and I discovered that Jean Francois Puget had already done that and achieved great results.

item.title: Python and VTK scientific visualisation
item.description: Background CrackVis is a visualisation tool which uses VTK to display a point cloud from ABAQUS 2D simulations. The input is a csv file which holds data in the following format: X Y Z1 Z2 … … … … … … Where \(X\) and \(Y\) are the coordinates of the nodes and \(Z_n\) is the data to be investigated.
